present participle of
swindle
to get money dishonestly from someone by deceiving or cheating them: They swindled local businesses out of thousands of dollars. The wealthy banker was ultimately convicted of swindling investors. Synonyms

con informal
defraud
diddle (TRICK) informal
gyp US informal old-fashioned
rook old-fashioned informal
